title.narrative: 303 QUALITY Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) PACKAGE IN INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: By 2022 government and partners are able to plan and implement the delivery of gender responsive and quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) package in schools, Anganwadi centres, and health care facilities, in the most vulnerable and deprived communities, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Infants, young children, and caregivers especially the most vulnerable have equitable access to and use sustainable, safe, and affordable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services (including in Institutions) across the lifecycle.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022 government and partners are able to plan and implement the delivery of gender responsive and quality WASH package in schools, Anganwadi centres, and health care facilities, in the most vulnerable and deprived communities

description.narrative: Through UNICEF support across 4 sectors (Education, Health, Women and Child development and WASH) key achievements include: (1) significant fund leveraging in states (~ INR 2.33 billion) for WiNS resulting in 69,192 schools provided with WASH package; (2) scaling-up capacity development for WASH in HCFs has led to achievement of 53% of delivery points in UNICEF supported HPDs with fully functional WASH/Infection Prevention and Control Package; (3) the development of child-friendly WASH in Anganwadi guidelines; (4) technical assistance and advocacy for MHM programming leading to provision of MHM friendly WASH facilities and counselling services in 14,416 schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020
